intro: Campanula trachelium var. racemosum, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features basal rosettes of narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowering stems bear clusters of flowers arranged in racemes, giving it its specific epithet "racemosum." It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats.
